docs.snippet: Something to eat and drink while you're watching one of the Big Five....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger visited the preview Oscar luncheon in New York at the Carlyle Hotel where the chef came up with a plate to mirror each movie. There will be video of this momentous event, but in the meantime, Grub Street conjured a list of drinkables to match the nominees, including:
docs.abstract: Something to eat and drink while you're watching one of the Big Five.

headline.main: Oscar Night Starting to Seem Like Another Super Bowl
headline.print_headline: Oscar Night Starting to Seem Like Another Super Bowl

docs.snippet: Do we have another culture clash to further aggravate relations between the U.S. and Iran?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Film critics in the United States may have intensely disliked the movie "300," but Iranians downright hated it from the top levels of its government to the man on the street.
docs.abstract: Do we have another culture clash to further aggravate relations between the U.S. and Iran?

docs.snippet: Handicapping the best actor award, and going out on a limb with a chainsaw....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger is still waiting for a copy of "There Will Be Blood" so he can check the view from the bubble. He knows that Daniel Day-Lewis is a lock for best actor, but had a naughty thought he should probably keep to himself, but that's not in his nature. If the Bagger were a member of the Academy, he would not be marching in lock-step with his peers to put the crown atop Mr. Lewis's head. He would instead pause, consider who did what in the context of the film, and mark the spot marked "Clooney."
docs.abstract: Handicapping the best actor award, and going out on a limb with a chainsaw.

headline.main: Picking the Lock on Best Actor
